ContractMetadata.name: ContractMetadata
ContractMetadata.remarks: Read and update metadata for this contract

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get the metadata of a contract
methods.remarks: Get the metadata of a contract

examples.javascript: const metadata = await contract.metadata.get();

methods.name: set
methods.summary: Set the metadata of a contract
methods.remarks: OVERWRITE the metadata of a contract

methods.name: update
methods.summary: Update the metadata of a contract
methods.remarks: Update the metadata of a contract

PlatformFee.name: ContractPlatformFee
PlatformFee.remarks: Configure platform fees for a contract, which can be applied on certain paid transactions

PrimarySale.name: ContractPrimarySale
PrimarySale.remarks: Configure primary sale recipients for an entire contract.

Permissions.name: ContractRoles
Permissions.remarks: Configure roles and permissions for a contract, to restrict certain actions.

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Call this to get a list of addresses that are members of a specific role.
methods.remarks: See {@link ContractRoles.getAll} to get get a list of addresses for all supported roles on the contract.

examples.javascript: const minterAddresses = await contract.roles.get("minter");

methods.name: getAll
methods.summary: Call this to get get a list of addresses for all supported roles on the contract.
methods.remarks: See {@link ContractRoles.get} to get a list of addresses that are members of a specific role.

examples.javascript: const rolesAndMembers = await contract.roles.getAll();

methods.name: grant
methods.summary: Call this to grant a role to a specific address.
methods.remarks: Make sure you are sure you want to grant the role to the address.

methods.name: revoke
methods.summary: Call this to revoke a role from a specific address.
methods.remarks:
-- Caution --

This will let you remove yourself from the role, too. If you remove yourself from the admin role, you will no longer be able to administer the contract. There is no way to recover from this.

methods.name: setAll
methods.summary:
Call this to OVERWRITE the list of addresses that are members of specific roles.

Every role in the list will be overwritten with the new list of addresses provided with them. If you want to add or remove addresses for a single address use {@link ContractRoles.grant} and {@link ContractRoles.revoke} respectively instead.

Royalty.name: ContractRoyalty
Royalty.remarks: Configure royalties for an entire contract or a particular token.

ERC1155.name: Erc1155
ERC1155.remarks: Basic functionality for a ERC1155 contract that handles IPFS storage for you.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
await contract.edition.transfer(walletAddress, tokenId, quantity);

methods.name: airdrop
methods.remarks: Airdrop one or multiple NFTs to the provided wallet addresses.

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets NFT balance (number of NFTs in this contract owned by the wallet).

examples.javascript: const nft = await contract.get("0");

methods.name: transfer
methods.remarks: Transfer an NFT from the connected wallet to another wallet.

ERC1155BatchMintable.name: Erc1155BatchMintable
ERC1155BatchMintable.summary: Mint Many ERC1155 NFTs at once
ERC1155BatchMintable.remarks: NFT batch minting functionality that handles IPFS storage for you.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
await contract.edition.mint.batch.to(walletAddress, [nftMetadataWithSupply1, nftMetadataWithSupply2, ...]);

methods.name: to
methods.summary: Mint Many NFTs with limited supplies
methods.remarks: Mint many different NFTs with limited supplies to a specified wallet.

methods.name: batch
methods.remarks: Burn the batch NFTs from the connected wallet

methods.name: batchFrom
methods.remarks: Burn the batch NFTs from the specified wallet

methods.name: from
methods.summary: Burn a specified amount of a NFTs
methods.remarks: Burn the specified NFTs from a specified wallet

methods.name: tokens
methods.summary: Burn a specified amount of a NFTs
methods.remarks: Burn the specified NFTs from the connected wallet

methods.name: lazyMint
methods.summary: Create a batch of NFTs to be claimed in the future
methods.remarks: Create batch allows you to create a batch of many NFTs in one transaction.

properties.name: claim
properties.summary: Claim tokens and configure claim conditions
properties.remarks: Let users claim NFTs. Define who can claim NFTs in the collection, when and how many.

ERC1155Enumerable.name: Erc1155Enumerable
ERC1155Enumerable.remarks: Easily list all the NFTs in a ERC1155 contract.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
const nfts = await contract.edition.query.all();

methods.name: all
methods.remarks:
Get all the data associated with every NFT in this contract.

By default, returns the first 100 NFTs, use queryParams to fetch more.

examples.javascript: const nfts = await contract.edition.query.all();

methods.name: owned
methods.remarks: Get all the data associated with the NFTs owned by a specific wallet.

ERC1155Mintable.name: Erc1155Mintable
ERC1155Mintable.remarks: NFT minting functionality that handles IPFS storage for you.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
await contract.edition.mint.to(walletAddress, nftMetadata);

methods.name: to
methods.summary: Mint an NFT with a limited supply
methods.remarks: Mint an NFT with a limited supply to a specified wallet.

ERC1155SignatureMintable.name: Erc1155SignatureMintable
ERC1155SignatureMintable.summary: Enables generating dynamic ERC1155 NFTs with rules and an associated signature, which can then be minted by anyone securely

methods.name: generate
methods.summary: Generate a signature that can be used to mint an NFT dynamically.
methods.remarks: Takes in an NFT and some information about how it can be minted, uploads the metadata and signs it with your private key. The generated signature can then be used to mint an NFT using the exact payload and signature generated.

methods.name: generateFromTokenId
methods.summary: Generate a signature that can be used to mint additionaly supply to an existing NFT.
methods.remarks: Takes in a payload with the token ID of an existing NFT, and signs it with your private key. The generated signature can then be used to mint additional supply to the NFT using the exact payload and signature generated.

methods.name: mint
methods.remarks: Mint a dynamic NFT with a previously generated signature.

ERC20.name: Erc20
ERC20.remarks: Basic functionality for a ERC20 contract that handles all unit transformation for you.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
await contract.token.transfer(walletAddress, amount);

methods.name: allowance
methods.remarks: Get the allowance of a 'spender' wallet over the connected wallet's funds - the allowance of a different address for a token is the amount of tokens that the `spender` wallet is allowed to spend on behalf of the connected wallet.

methods.name: allowanceOf
methods.remarks: Get the allowance of one wallet over another wallet's funds - the allowance of a different address for a token is the amount of tokens that the wallet is allowed to spend on behalf of the specified wallet.

methods.name: balance
methods.summary: Get Token Balance for the currently connected wallet
methods.remarks: Get a wallets token balance.

examples.javascript: const balance = await contract.token.balance();

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets token balance.

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get the token Metadata (name, symbol, etc...)

examples.javascript: const token = await contract.token.get();

methods.name: setAllowance
methods.summary: Allows the specified `spender` wallet to transfer the given `amount` of tokens to another wallet

methods.name: totalSupply
methods.summary: The total supply for this Token
methods.remarks: Get how much supply has been minted

examples.javascript: const balance = await contract.token.totalSupply();

methods.name: transfer
methods.remarks: Transfer tokens from the connected wallet to another wallet.

methods.name: transferBatch
methods.remarks: Mint tokens from the connected wallet to many wallets

methods.name: transferFrom
methods.remarks: Transfer tokens from one wallet to another

ERC20BatchMintable.name: Erc20BatchMintable
ERC20BatchMintable.summary: Mint Many ERC20 Tokens at once
ERC20BatchMintable.remarks: Token batch minting functionality that handles unit parsing for you.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
await contract.token.mint.batch.to(walletAddress, [nftMetadata1, nftMetadata2, ...]);

methods.name: to
methods.remarks: Mint tokens to many wallets in one transaction.

methods.name: from
methods.remarks: Burn tokens held by the specified wallet

methods.name: tokens
methods.remarks: Burn tokens held by the connected wallet

ERC20Mintable.name: Erc20Mintable
ERC20Mintable.remarks: Token minting functionality that handles unit parsing for you.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
await contract.nft.mint.to(walletAddress, nftMetadata);

methods.name: to
methods.remarks: Mint tokens to a specified address.

ERC20SignatureMintable.name: Erc20SignatureMintable
ERC20SignatureMintable.summary: Enables generating ERC20 Tokens with rules and an associated signature, which can then be minted by anyone securely

methods.name: generate
methods.summary: Generate a signature that can be used to mint a certain amount of tokens
methods.remarks: Takes in a quantity of tokens, some conditions for how it can be minted and signs it with your private key. The generated signature can then be used to mint those tokens using the exact payload and signature generated.

methods.name: mint
methods.remarks: Mint a certain amount of tokens from a previously generated signature.

ERC721.name: Erc721
ERC721.remarks: Basic functionality for a ERC721 contract that handles IPFS storage for you.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
await contract.nft.transfer(walletAddress, tokenId);

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets NFT balance (number of NFTs in this contract owned by the wallet).

examples.javascript:
const tokenId = 0;
const nft = await contract.nft.get(tokenId);

methods.name: transfer
methods.remarks: Transfer an NFT from the connected wallet to another wallet.

ERC721BatchMintable.name: Erc721BatchMintable
ERC721BatchMintable.summary: Mint Many ERC721 NFTs at once
ERC721BatchMintable.remarks: NFT batch minting functionality that handles IPFS storage for you.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
await contract.nft.mint.batch.to(walletAddress, [nftMetadata1, nftMetadata2, ...]);

methods.name: to
methods.remarks: Mint many unique NFTs at once to a specified wallet.

methods.name: token
methods.remarks: Burn NFTs held by the connected wallet

ERC721Claimable.name: Erc721Claimable
ERC721Claimable.summary: Lazily mint and claim ERC721 NFTs
ERC721Claimable.remarks: Manage claim phases and claim ERC721 NFTs that have been lazily minted.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
await contract.drop.claim.to("0x...", quantity);

methods.name: to
methods.summary: Claim unique NFTs to a specific Wallet
methods.remarks: Let the specified wallet claim NFTs.

examples.javascript:
const address = "{{wallet_address}}"; // address of the wallet you want to claim the NFTs
const quantity = 1; // how many unique NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.nft.drop.claim.to(address, quantity);
const receipt = tx[0].receipt; // the transaction receipt
const claimedTokenId = tx[0].id; // the id of the first NFT claimed
const claimedNFT = await tx[0].data(); // (optional) get the first claimed NFT metadata

properties.name: conditions
properties.remarks: Define who can claim NFTs in the collection, when and how many.

ERC721Droppable.name: Erc721Droppable
ERC721Droppable.summary: Lazily mint and claim ERC721 NFTs
ERC721Droppable.remarks: Manage claim phases and claim ERC721 NFTs that have been lazily minted.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
await contract.drop.claim(quantity);

methods.name: lazyMint
methods.summary: Create a batch of unique NFTs to be claimed in the future
methods.remarks: Create batch allows you to create a batch of many unique NFTs in one transaction.

properties.name: claim
properties.summary: Claim tokens and configure claim conditions
properties.remarks: Let users claim NFTs. Define who can claim NFTs in the collection, when and how many.

examples.javascript:
const quantity = 10;
await contract.nft.drop.claim.to("0x...", quantity);

ERC721Enumerable.name: Erc721Enumerable
ERC721Enumerable.remarks: Easily list all the NFTs from a ERC721 contract, owned by a certain wallet.

methods.name: all
methods.remarks: Get all the data associated with the NFTs owned by a specific wallet.

ERC721Mintable.name: Erc721Mintable
ERC721Mintable.remarks: NFT minting functionality that handles IPFS storage for you.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
await contract.nft.mint.to(walletAddress, nftMetadata);

methods.name: to
methods.remarks: Mint a unique NFT to a specified wallet.

ERC721Supply.name: Erc721Supply
ERC721Supply.remarks: Easily list all the NFTs in a ERC721 contract.

examples.javascript:
const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
const nfts = await contract.nft.query.all();

methods.name: all
methods.remarks:
Get all the data associated with every NFT in this contract.

By default, returns the first 100 NFTs, use queryParams to fetch more.

examples.javascript: const nfts = await contract.nft.query.all();

ERC721SignatureMint.name: Erc721WithQuantitySignatureMintable
ERC721SignatureMint.summary: Enables generating dynamic ERC721 NFTs with rules and an associated signature, which can then be minted by anyone securely

methods.name: generate
methods.summary: Generate a signature that can be used to mint a dynamic NFT
methods.remarks: Takes in an NFT and some information about how it can be minted, uploads the metadata and signs it with your private key. The generated signature can then be used to mint an NFT using the exact payload and signature generated.

methods.name: mint
methods.remarks: Mint a dynamic NFT with a previously generated signature.
